text: Beni mikase nii kɛshɛ he ko lɛ , mibale nibii babaoo yɛ Yehowa he , ni no ha mitsi mibɛŋkɛ lɛ .
ref: As my studies progressed , I learned many things about Jehovah that drew me to him .
translated: We know that God is our Father, and that is why we call him Jehovah, and we do his will.

text: Beni mina anɔkwale lɛ sɛɛ nɔŋŋ kɛkɛ ni minyɛ gbo , ni ebalɛ akɛ esa akɛ maku misɛɛ kɛya North Carolina kɛha eyarafeemɔ .
ref: Soon after I accepted the truth , my mother passed away , and I had to return to North Carolina for her funeral .
translated: My mother told me that when I grow up, I will go to school, and I will become a big person in the city of North Carolina in America.

text: Beni mina lɛ nɔ ni ji naagbee nɔ lɛ , ekɛ etoii ni gbokɛlɛfoi ahe bulɔi lɛ kɛ tu sɛɛ tsei efite lɛ kwraa lɛ tsɔɔ mi .
ref: When I last saw him , he showed me his ears that prison guards had smashed with rifle butts .
translated: When I came here, I saw that the women were many, but the men were few, that is why I am advising you to take care of your wives.

text: Beni mitee helatsamɔhe lɛ , no mli lɛ kpiti lɛ ehe shi yɛ mimli .
ref: By the time I went to the hospital , the leprosy had taken a firm hold .
translated: When I went to the farm, I saw a big snake in the bush.

text: Beni mɔ fɛɛ mɔ baaye emuu lɛ , toiŋjɔlɛ he naatsii ko ehiŋ shi
ref: When everyone is perfect , there will be no obstacles to peace
translated: My mother has gone to the farm with my younger sibling

text: Beni mɛi krokomɛi ni yɔɔ jɛmɛ lɛ na Kristofonyo nɛɛ shidaamɔ ni yɔɔ ekãa lɛ , amɛ hu amɛkpoo baai lɛ .
ref: On seeing this Christian 's fearless stand , others in attendance likewise refused the herbs .
translated: When I went to Krobo market and saw Christopher's sister, I was very happy and I ran to her.

text: Beni shitsalɔ Austen Layard wieɔ maŋtsɛmɛi awe ni eyana yɛ Ashur maŋtiase Ninive lɛ fã ko he lɛ , eŋma akɛ : " Ajara . . . tsũ lɛ mligbɛ yiteŋ lɛ mli awo fãi ni hiɛ koji ejwɛ ni kɛlɛmɔ yeɔ egbɔ mli , ni atɛŋ fɔfɔii loo atɛŋ kooloi ahe mfonirii yɛ nɔ .
ref: Describing one section of a royal palace that he had uncovered in the Assyrian capital of Nineveh , archaeologist Austen Layard wrote : " The ceilings . . . were divided into square compartments , painted with flowers , or with the figures of animals .
translated: When Austen Layard excavated the palace of Ashur at Nineveh, he found this: "I am . . . the king who built the palace for my royal residence, where I may dwell, and where the successors who come after me may also dwell.

text: Beni wɔbɔɔ mɔdɛŋ ni wɔpɛi agora lɛ blema shihilɛ lɛ mli lɛ , nyɛhaa wɔshia hoofeemɔ kɛ gidigidifeemɔ ni yɔɔ ŋmɛnɛŋmɛnɛ beaŋ maŋtiase lɛŋ , ni wɔyi mli kɛtsɔ nane gbɛ ̀ i kɛ enɔ ŋmilitsa lɛ anɔ , yɛ marmaratɛi ni efite kɛjwere shi lɛ ateaŋ , yɛ tɛi ni akpɛ lɛ ateaŋ , kɛ agbói ni efufulu ni jwɛi ni etsa kusuu yɛ nɔ lɛ ateaŋ .
ref: In an effort to examine the agora 's past , let us leave behind the noise and bustle of the modern - day city and make our way along gravel paths , in among the silent marble ruins , the carved stones , and the crumbling portals overgrown with weeds and wild herbs .
translated: They went to the farm and cleared the land, then they planted maize and after some time they harvested it, they took it to the market to sell, and with the money they got, they bought food and clothes, and they also bought a goat and a sheep and a pig to raise at home.

text: Beni yinɔsaneŋmalɔ Datrɛfonyo de Jong wieɔ tawuu be mli Odasefoi nɛɛ ahe lɛ , ekpɛlɛ nɔ akɛ : " Amɛteŋ mɛi babaoo diɛŋtsɛ sumɔɔɔ akɛ amɛaakwa amɛhemɔkɛyeli lɛ yɛ hegbeyeiwoi kɛ piŋmɔ lɛ fɛɛ sɛɛ . "
ref: Speaking about these wartime Witnesses , historian Dr . de Jong acknowledges : " The very great majority of them refused to deny their faith in spite of threats and torture . "
translated: Beni asked Datrɛfonyo de Jong how it would be possible for someone to be a teacher and not be a servant, and he replied: "If you are a teacher, you are a servant to the community, because you are serving the community, and that is what teaching is all about."

text: Betel nifeemɔi ni minyaa he waa lɛ ateŋ ekome ji leebi jamɔ ni Nyɛminuu Knorr kwɛɔ nɔ lɛ .
ref: One of my favorite times at Bethel was morning worship , conducted by Brother Knorr .
translated: When I went to the farm yesterday, I saw a big snake at the edge of the farm near Nyɛminuu Knorr's house.

text: Betrayal - German Churches and the Holocaust lɛ wie akɛ , kɛlɛ Odasefoi lɛ " tee nɔ amɛja woji bibii lɛ ni amɛhiɛ amɛnɔkwayeli lɛ mli . "
ref: Yet , the Witnesses " continued to distribute pamphlets and otherwise maintain their faith , " notes Betrayal - German Churches and the Holocaust .
translated: The German churches and their leaders were complicit in the Nazi regime's atrocities, saying "we only obeyed the laws of the land"

text: Biblia Kaselɔ lɛ ha mimami woji bibii komɛi , ni etsɛɛɛ ni eyɔse anɔkwalei ni yɔɔ mli lɛ .
ref: Mother accepted some booklets from the Bible Student and soon recognized the ring of truth .
translated: The Bible says that all scripture is inspired by God and is useful for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness.

text: Biblia lɛ bɔɔ kɔkɔ akɛ : " Mɛi ni taoɔ nii pii aná lɛ gbeeɔ kaa kɛ tsɔne kɛ kwashiai akɔnɔi pii ni fiteɔ mɔ ní tsiɔ mɛi ewoɔ hiɛkpatamɔ kɛ laajemɔ mli lɛ amli . " - 1 Timoteo 6 : 9 .
ref: The Bible warns : " Those who are determined to be rich fall into temptation and a snare and many senseless and hurtful desires , which plunge men into destruction and ruin . " - 1 Timothy 6 : 9 .
translated: But those who want to be rich fall into temptation and a trap and into many foolish and harmful desires that plunge people into ruin and destruction.

text: Biblia lɛ etsɛ waa moŋ , shi etsuɔ hiamɔ nii nɛɛ ahe nii , ni efeɔ fe nakai po .
ref: As old as it is , the Bible addresses those needs and more .
translated: The Bible is a book that tells us about God's love for us and how we can have eternal life through faith in Him.

text: Biblia lɛ haa hetoo akɛ : " Ejaakɛ enɛ hi ni eŋɔɔ Nyɔŋmɔ ni ji wɔyiwalaherelɔ lɛ naa , mɔ ni sumɔɔ akɛ ehere gbɔmɛi fɛɛ yiwala , koni amɛshɛ anɔkwale lɛ lee mli . "
ref: The Bible answers : " This is fine and acceptable in the sight of our Savior , God , whose will is that all sorts of men should be saved and come to an accurate knowledge of truth . "
translated: The Bible also says: "If you obey my commands, I will send you rain in its season, and the land will yield its crops, and the trees of the field will produce their fruit."

text: Biblia lɛ jeee Yudafoi kɛ Kristofoi awoji komɛi kɛkɛ ni abua naa afee lɛ wolo kome .
ref: The Bible is no mere collection of unrelated Jewish and Christian literature .
translated: The Bible is the holy book of the Jews and Christians, which contains the word of God and is used for worship and teaching.

text: Biblia lɛ ji Nyɔŋmɔ Wiemɔ ni ekɛ emumɔ lɛ tsirɛ mɛi ni amɛŋmala .
ref: The Bible is the inspired Word of God .
translated: The Bible is the word of God and it is the power of God for the salvation of everyone

text: Biblia lɛ ji map ni baanyɛ aye abua bo ni ona gbɛ ni esa akɛ otsɔ nɔ .
ref: The Bible is a map that can help you to know which path to choose .
translated: The Bible says that people who do not obey the law will be punished.

text: Biblia lɛ kɛ " nilelɔi awiemɔi " toɔ tsina kpalamɔtsei ni kanyaa mɔ koni eya ehiɛ yɛ jalɛ gbɛ lɛ nɔ lɛ he .
ref: The Bible likens " the words of the wise ones " to oxgoads that prod us to move forward in the right direction .
translated: The Bible is the "word of God" that guides our lives and helps us to know and understand what God wants us to do.

text: Biblia lɛ kɛ wiemɔ ni ji " miishɛjemɔ " lɛ tsu nii nɔ ni fa fe shii ohai abɔ yɛ gbɛ ̀ i srɔtoi anɔ , koni wɔná nɔmimaa akɛ jeee akɛ Nyɔŋmɔ nuɔ shihilɛi ni wɔkɛkpeɔ lɛ ashishi kɛkɛ , shi eesumɔ ni eshɛje wɔmii .
ref: The Bible uses " comfort " in various forms over a hundred times , assuring us that God not only understands what we face but also desires to comfort us .
translated: The Bible is the book that tells us about "faith" and how we can have a relationship with God, and how He loves us so much that He sent His only Son Jesus Christ to die for our sins.

text: Biblia lɛ kɛɔ akɛ " buulufeemɔ kpɛtɛ gbekɛ tsui he . "
ref: The Bible says that " foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child . "
translated: The Bible says "the truth will set you free."

text: Biblia lɛ kɛɔ wɔ akɛ , Yehowa Nyɔŋmɔ futu gbɔmɛi lɛ awiemɔ yɛ Babel akɛni amɛtse ehiɛ atua lɛ hewɔ .
ref: The Bible tells us that Jehovah God confused the people 's language at Babel because they rebelled against him .
translated: The Bible says that when Jehovah God confused the language at Babel all those who were united in that project were scattered.

text: Biblia lɛ maa nɔ mi akɛ : " Mɛi ni nyiɛɔ emuuyeli mli lɛ , ekamaaa amɛ nɔ kpakpa ko nɔ kpakpa ko . " - Lala 84 : 12 .
ref: The Bible assures : " Jehovah himself will not hold back anything good from those walking in faultlessness . " - Psalm 84 : 11 .
translated: The Bible says to us: "If I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful."

text: Biblia lɛ maa nɔ mi ehaa wɔ akɛ , Yehowa hiɛ sɔɔ mɔdɛŋ ni mɛi ni kɛ amɛnifeemɔ tsɔɔ akɛ amɛyɛ hemɔkɛyeli yɛ emli lɛ bɔɔ lɛ .
ref: It assures us that Jehovah appreciates the efforts of his faithful worshippers .
translated: The Bible tells us that in the beginning, Jehovah created the heavens and the earth and that the earth was without form and empty

text: Biblia lɛ tsɔɔ akɛ , naagbee gbii lɛ amli lɛ " jaramɔ bei baaba . "
ref: The Bible indicates that in the last days , there would be " critical times hard to deal with . "
translated: The Bible says that, and it is true that "pride goes before a fall."

text: Biblia lɛ wie yɛ Dorka he akɛ , " eyi obɔ kɛ nitsumɔi kpakpai kɛ ejuji ni efeɔ ohiafoi lɛ . "
ref: Dorcas " abounded in good deeds and gifts of mercy . "
translated: The Bible says in Proverbs, "do not answer a fool according to his folly lest you be like him"

text: Biblia mli saji tsɔɔ akɛ Yesu yɛ shwelɛ kɛ hewalɛ ni ekɛaaha gbekɛbii ni egboi lɛ aba wala mli ekoŋŋ
ref: Bible accounts show that Jesus has the power and the desire to bring children back to life
translated: The Bible says that Jesus is the way to heaven and that whoever believes in him will not perish but have eternal life

text: Biblia mli shishitoo mlai lɛ kɛ nitsumɔ ha nyɛ ̃ ɛ ni kã wiemɔ kui enyɔ nɛɛ mli bii babaoo ateŋ lɛ je jɛmɛ .
ref: The application of Bible principles melted the animosity that exists between many from these two ethnic groups .
translated: The Bible says that if you are a child of God, you will not live a sinful life, because God's seed remains in him and he cannot sin because he is a child of God.

text: Biblia shishitsɔɔlɔi komɛi kɛ nakai wiemɔi lɛ nɔŋŋ tsu nii .
ref: Some Bible versions use exactly that expression .
translated: The Bible is the word of God that he spoke to his people.

text: Biblia ŋmalɔ ni akɛ mumɔ tsirɛ lɛ lɛ tsɔ hiɛ ebɔ wɔ kɔkɔ yɛ wɔbe nɛɛ , ni ji " naagbee gbii " lɛ ahe , ni ekɛɛ akɛ : " Gbɔmɛi fɔji kɛ shishiulɔi aaawo wu yɛ efɔŋ mli ; amɛlakaa mɛi ni amɛ hu alakaa amɛ . "
ref: The inspired Bible writer forewarns us about our time , " the last days , " and says : " Wicked men and impostors will advance from bad to worse , misleading and being misled . "
translated: The Bible says that a worker deserves his wages, and Paul also says: "Anyone who does not provide for their relatives, and especially for their own household, has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever."

text: Biblia ŋmalɔi kɛ sui komɛi ni okropɔŋ yɔɔ lɛ tsuɔ nii amɛkɛfeɔ nibii tamɔ nilee , ŋwɛi hebuu , kɛ oyaiyeli he okadi . - 6 / 15 , baafa 8 .
ref: Bible writers alluded to characteristics of the eagle to symbolize such things as wisdom , divine protection , and swiftness . - 6 / 15 , page 8 .
translated: The Bible says that if you are a thief, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven, unless you repent, and also if you are a drunkard.

text: Biɛ ji he ni mikã he misɔmɔɔ lolo yɛ Yehowa Odasefoi ashika he nitsumɔi amli lɛ yɛ .
ref: Here I continue to serve in connection with the financial activities of Jehovah 's Witnesses .
translated: We know that we are children of Jehovah and that he helps us in all our endeavors.

text: Blema adesãi lɛ ekomɛi po kɛ nikpamɔ be toɔ gbɔmɔ ni akɛ lɛ shaa afɔle he - ni ji nifeemɔ ko ni Yehowa Nyɔŋmɔ hiɔ . - 3 Mose 20 : 2 ; Yeremia 7 : 30 , 31 .
ref: Other legends even connect harvesttime with human sacrifice - a practice that Jehovah God detests . - Leviticus 20 : 2 ; Jeremiah 7 : 30 , 31 .
translated: And you must throw away all the wicked people from among you, and all the assembly of Israel must stone them, and they will know that I am Jehovah.—3 Moses 20:2; Jeremiah 7:30, 31.

text: Blonya - Je lɛ Gbi Jurɔ loo Jamɔ Gbi Krɔŋkrɔŋ ?
ref: Christmas - Secular Holiday or Religious Holy Day ?
translated: How are you, my friend from the town of Gbi?

text: Bo diɛŋtsɛ susumɔ bɔ ni Yudafoi lɛ ayiŋ baafutu amɛ aha , akɛni amɛnu he yɛ be kplaŋŋ mli akɛ Nyɔŋmɔ baabu amɛ kɛ amɛmaŋtiase krɔŋkrɔŋ lɛ he lɛ he okwɛ !
ref: Just think how confused the Jews would have been , since they had long felt that God would protect them and their holy city !
translated: All the days of the poor are hard, but a cheerful heart has a continual feast, and the evil will bow to the good!

text: Bo lɛ susumɔ bɔ ni Abraham , ni no mli lɛ atsɛɔ lɛ Abram lɛ nu he eha beni Yehowa kɛɛ lɛ akɛ : " Jee oshikpɔŋ lɛ nɔ kɛ ojaku lɛ . . . kɛya shikpɔŋ ni matsɔɔo lɛ nɔ " lɛ he okwɛ .
ref: We can only imagine how Abraham , then Abram , felt when Jehovah told him : " Go your way out of your country and from your relatives . . . to the country that I shall show you . "
translated: Now Abraham was old, and well advanced in age, and the Lord had blessed Abraham in every way, and he said: "I swear by myself . . . that I will bless you"

text: Bo lɛ susumɔ bɔ ni ofeɔ okɛ onaanyo ko ni kɛ bo teŋ jekɛ lɛ gbaa sane lɛ he okwɛ .
ref: You could write to each other often and talk on the telephone .
translated: When you are going to farm and you see a snake on your way, you will turn back and go home.

text: Bo lɛ susumɔ he okwɛ : Anáŋ asraafoi akui , tawuu nibii , loo hei ni akɛkaiɔ mɛi ni egboi yɛ ta mli .
ref: Just think - no armies , navies , or air forces ! No weapons or war memorials .
translated: When the war started, the soldiers came, killed people, and took away our livestock and food, and that's why we are suffering.

text: Bofɔ Yohane haa hetoo akɛ : " Enɛ ji Nyɔŋmɔ suɔmɔ lɛ , akɛ wɔye ekitai lɛ anɔ ; ni ekitai lɛ waaa . " - Mateo 22 : 37 ; 1 Yohane 5 : 3 .
ref: The apostle John answers : " This is what the love of God means , that we observe his commandments ; and yet his commandments are not burdensome . " - Matthew 22 : 37 ; 1 John 5 : 3 .
translated: John answered and said: "If you love the Lord with all your heart, then you will love your neighbour as yourself; and your neighbour is your brother."

text: Bruni ná hejɔlɛ beni ena kɛjɛ Biblia lɛ mli akɛ esaaa akɛ ashwaa Yehowa yɛ amanehulu he , akɛ jeee eyiŋtoo ji ni adesai apiŋ , ni akɛ etsɛŋ ni ekɛ efɔŋ baaba naagbee lɛ .
ref: Bruni experienced relief once she saw from the Bible that Jehovah is not to blame for adversity , that he never purposed for mankind to suffer , and that he will soon put an end to evil .
translated: They do not know that the Bible says that God's name, Jehovah, is holy and that we should respect it, and also that we should use it when we pray and when we talk about him.

text: Bulɛ ni eyɔɔ lɛ gbala nikaselɔi 1,200 ni baa eskul lɛ daa kɛba eŋɔɔ , ni akpei abɔ baa yɛ Yudafoi anyɔŋ ni ji Adar kɛ Elul lɛ nɔ .
ref: His reputation drew 1,200 regular students to his academy , with thousands more in attendance during the Jewish months of Adar and Elul .
translated: There were about 1,200 men in the army and the school was closed, and the war started on the 10th of Av and ended on the 10th of Elul.

text: Bɔ fɛɛ bɔ ni fee lɛ , okɛ naatsĩi baakpe , ni yɛ bei komɛi amli lɛ , okɛ nijiaŋwujee henumɔi ni sɛɛ etsɛɛɛ po baakpe .
ref: You are bound to run into obstacles and at times may even experience a temporary sense of failure .
translated: They will come and take the child, and when they come to our town, they will show the child to the elders and the elders will give them food

text: Bɔ ni Biblia mli wiemɔi ni yɔɔ faŋŋ lɛ tsɔɔ lɛ , esa akɛ wɔmu sane naa akɛ , gbɔmɔ bɛ susuma ni gbooo ni baanyɛ ahi shi yɛ egbɔmɔtso lɛ gbele sɛɛ .
ref: According to clear Biblical statements , we must conclude that man does not possess an immortal soul that can survive the death of his body .
translated: For as the rain comes down and the snow from heaven, and do not return there, but water the earth, and make it bring forth and bud, that it may give seed to the sower and bread to the eater

text: Bɔ ni Farao kɛ esraafoi lɛ yeee omanye lɛ , nakai nɔŋŋ mɛi ni teɔ shi woɔ Nyɔŋmɔ lɛ hu yeŋ omanye .
ref: Opposers of God will fail , just as Pharaoh and his army failed .
translated: When the Pharaoh woke up early in the morning, he did not know what to do so he called his wise men.

text: Bɔ ni Ooofee Owaje Ohetuu - kɛhamɔ Lɛ
ref: A key factor is humbly to apply the advice of God 's Word , the Bible .
translated: They are coming to the farm of Ohetuu - at Lɛ hamlet

text: Bɔ ni afee ni mɛi ni baa yɛ sɛɛ lɛ anine ashɛ Biblia mli sane lɛ nɔ lɛ , akwɛɔ nɔ ni yɔɔ momo lɛ nɔ akɛ niji ŋmalaa eko .
ref: To pass on the message , those writings had to be carefully copied and recopied by hand .
translated: When we read the Bible, we must also pray to God to give us wisdom to understand it.

text: Bɔ ni ebalɛ ji akɛ , mɛi ni tsaa shi kɛtaoɔ blema nibii lɛ miitsa shi yɛ he ko kɛ hiɛnɔkamɔ akɛ amɛbaana Maŋtsɛ David maŋtsɛwe lɛ .
ref: Archaeologists were digging at a site where they hoped to find King David 's palace .
translated: When I went to the farm, my mother gave me a small basket to fetch some vegetables for my younger brother David.

text: Bɔ ni ebalɛ nɛ :
ref: It happened this way :
translated: They are in the village

text: Bɔ ni eyɔɔ ŋshɔnaa gbɛ hewɔ lɛ , efeɔ he ko ni hi jogbaŋŋ kɛha shwɛmɔi akwɛmɔ .
ref: Facing the sea , it offered a spectacular setting for the performances .
translated: They are the ones who will come and take over the town when we are gone, that's why we should teach them good things.

text: Bɔ ni gbɛjianɔtoo nɛɛ yɔɔ hewɔ lɛ , kɛ ́ amralofoi lɛ ná le ehe nɔ ko fioo po lɛ , ebaanyɛ ekɛ naagba wulu aba .
ref: So interwoven was this underground distribution network that any disclosure could have far - reaching effects .
translated: When the elephant is about to give birth, it goes to a secluded place, where it will deliver its baby in peace, and the other elephants will gather around to help.

text: Bɔfo Paulo gba efɔ ̃ shi akɛ , yɛ " naagbee gbii lɛ anɔ lɛ , " gbɔmɛi babaoo naŋ ' hedɔɔ amɛhaŋ mɛi . '
ref: The apostle Paul foretold that in " the last days " many people would lack " natural affection . "
translated: Paul said to them, "You should not have done this, now you have brought trouble on yourselves and on us."

text: Bɔfo Paulo hu tsɔ ̃ kaai ni mli wa waa bei amli .
ref: The apostle Paul too went through periods of severe trial .
translated: Paul the fool has eaten all the food in the house.

text: Bɔfo Paulo kɛ Petro fɛɛ tsɛ ́ Hoshea 2 : 23 lɛ yisɛɛ kɛkɔ mumɔŋ Israel shwɛɛnii lɛ anaabuamɔ he . - Romabii 9 : 25 , 26 ; 1 Petro 2 : 10 .
ref: The apostles Paul and Peter apply Hosea 2 : 23 to the gathering of a remnant of spiritual Israel . - Romans 9 : 25 , 26 ; 1 Peter 2 : 10 .
translated: And the Lord said to him: “Call his name Loammi, for you are not my people and I am not your God.” —Hoshea 2:23, but now he calls them “my people,” those who were not shown mercy, just as if they were the ones shown mercy.

text: Bɔfo Paulo kɛɛ akɛ : " Be lɛ faaa dɔŋŋ ; nɔ ni eshwɛ ji akɛ , mɛi ni yɔɔ ŋamɛi tete afee tamɔ mɛi ni bɛ eko . "
ref: " The time left is reduced , " said the apostle Paul . " Henceforth let those who have wives be as though they had none . "
translated: Mr. Paulo said: "You are very foolish; if you don't listen to advice, you will suffer greatly and you will regret it."

text: Bɔfo Paulo tsɛ nɛkɛ Kristofoi amaŋ hee nɛɛ akɛ " Nyɔŋmɔ Israel . "
ref: The apostle Paul called this new Christian nation " the Israel of God . "
translated: Paul, a servant of Christ Jesus, called to be an apostle, set apart for the gospel of God.

text: Bɔfo Petro kɛɛ akɛ : " Nakai nɔŋŋ nyɛ yeigbayei lɛ hu , nyɛbaa nyɛhe shi nyɛhaa nyɛ diɛŋtsɛ nyɛwumɛi lɛ , koni , kɛ ́ mɛi komɛi booo wiemɔ lɛ toi tete lɛ , ashi wiemɔ lɛ sɛɛ ni atsɔ yei lɛ ajeŋba nɔ ni nine ashɛ amɛnɔ , ejaakɛ amɛnaa nyɛjeŋba ni hetsemɔ kɛ gbeyeishemɔ yɔɔ mli lɛ . "
ref: The apostle Peter says : " You wives , be in subjection to your own husbands , in order that , if any are not obedient to the word , they may be won without a word through the conduct of their wives , because of having been eyewitnesses of your chaste conduct together with deep respect . "
translated: Mr. Petro said: "If you want to be a great person, you must first be a servant to all people, because the one who serves is the one who will be great, and if you are not a servant, you cannot be a leader, and if you are a leader, you must serve, and if you serve, you will be great."

text: Bɔfo Petro ŋma wumɛi akɛ : " Nyɛkɛ [ nyɛ ŋamɛi lɛ ] ahia shi yɛ nilee naa , ni nyɛkɛ woo awoa yoo akɛ nɔ ni he waaa tuutu ko , akɛni amɛkɛ nyɛ fɛɛ ji wala duromɔ lɛ wɔfasei lɛ , koni akatsimɔ nyɛsɔlemɔi lɛ agbɛ . "
ref: The apostle Peter wrote to husbands : " Continue dwelling in like manner with [ your wives ] according to knowledge , assigning them honor as to a weaker vessel , the feminine one , since you are also heirs with them of the undeserved favor of life , in order for your prayers not to be hindered . "
translated: that the child is not a thief

text: Bɔfo Yakobo bɔ kɔkɔ akɛ : " Lilɛi lɛ , gbɔmɔ ko gbɔmɔ ko nyɛɛɛ ehe ajɔɔ . "
ref: " The tongue , " warns the disciple James , " not one of mankind can get it tamed . "
translated: Mr Jacob said: "Today, every child is a child indeed."

text: Bɔfoi lɛ ateŋ mɛi ni ji wuoyalɔi lɛ atsui nyɔ amɛmli yɛ looi babaoo ni amɛgbe lɛ hewɔ .
ref: The apostles who were fishermen were likely gratified by a good catch .
translated: The hunter and his dog went to the forest to hunt, but they did not catch any animal, so they returned home empty-handed.

text: Bɔni Fee ni B.C . - A.D .
ref: How the B.C . - A.D .
translated: From the year before Christ to the year of our Lord

text: Bɔni afee ni Israel maŋtsɛ lɛ atsɔɔ bɔ ni Nyɔŋmɔ Wiemɔ lɛ ni ahaa ekudɔɔ mɔ lɛ he hiaa ha lɛ mli lɛ , ekɛ naabu lɛ to tso ni woɔ yibii he .
ref: To show the importance of being guided by God 's Word in our speech , the king of Israel likens the mouth to a fruit - bearing tree .
translated: They were in Israel for three years and six months and when they came back to Ghana they were given a plot of land to build their house but they were cheated and the land was taken from them.

text: Bɔni afee ni Yesu ato enaagbee Hehoo lɛ he gbɛjianɔ lɛ , ekɛɛ ekaselɔi lɛ akɛ , " nyɛyaa maŋ lɛŋ ni nyɛyakɛa ashimashi [ " nuu ko , " The New English Bible ] " koni efee nibii klalo yɛ eshĩa .
ref: To prepare for his final Passover meal , Jesus told his disciples to " go into the city to So - and - so [ " a certain man , " The New English Bible ] " and get things ready at his home .
translated: The New English Bible

text: Bɔni afee ni anyɛ atsu enɛ he nii lɛ , atsɔɔ Biblia lɛ shishi kɛtee wiemɔi babaoo amli fe woji krokomɛi fɛɛ ni yɔɔ je lɛ mli .
ref: To that end , the Bible has been translated into more languages than any other book in the world .
translated: When we read the Bible, we see that God loves us so much that he gave his only son to die for our sins.

text: Bɔni afee ni madamɔ naa lɛ , miyaa Maŋtsɛyeli Asa lɛ nɔ beni mɛi lɛ etara shi , ni mishiɔ amrɔ nɔŋŋ dani jɛmɛ feɔ hoo beni akpa kpee lɛ .
ref: To cope , I usually entered the Kingdom Hall after the crowd settled down and left just before it began to stir at the end of the program .
translated: When the chief's wife died, the people of Mancheli Asa said that they would not allow her to be buried, and that they would fight to prevent it from happening there.

text: Bɔni afee ni okwaafonyo akpa yibii kpakpai babaoo lɛ , sũ loo shikpɔŋ ni baa nii , hulu , kɛ nu he miihia .
ref: To reap a good crop , a farmer needs fertile soil , warm sunshine , and water .
translated: When the moon is full, the women go to the river to fetch water, and the men go to hunt, and they bring back meat.

text: Bɔni afee ni ona bɔ ni ehe hiaa ni okɛ hiɛdɔɔ atsu Nyɔŋmɔ sɔɔmɔ nitsumɔ lɛ , kadimɔ nɔ ko ni ba yɛ Israel maŋtsɛ Yoash shihilɛ mli .
ref: To illustrate the importance of being zealous in God 's service , note an event that took place in the life of King Jehoash of Israel .
translated: And Jehoash said to the priests, All the money of the dedicated things that is brought into the house of the Lord, even the money of every man's census, and all the money that comes into any man's heart to bring into the house of the Lord.

text: Bɔni afee ni wɔna akɛ Yehowa yeɔ eshiwoo nɛɛ nɔ lɛ , nyɛhaa wɔkɛ mɔ nitsumɔ ní jeɔ edɛŋ trukaa lɛ afea he nɔkwɛmɔnɔ wɔkwɛa .
ref: To see how Jehovah can act on this promise , let us consider the example of a sudden loss of one 's livelihood .
translated: Because they know that Jehovah is God and they are not, they will abandon their idols and turn to him in his due time and he will save them.

text: Bɔɔ mɔdɛŋ ni ofee enɛ amrɔ nɔŋŋ .
ref: Try to do it very soon .
translated: They will come and take the child and go

text: Bɔɔ mɔdɛŋ ni okɛ ohe awo eshihilɛ lɛ mli , ni onu lɛ shishi .
ref: Try to relate to her and understand her reactions .
translated: They are not going to the farm today because the rain is falling heavily

text: Caucasus Gɔji
ref: Caucasus Mountains
translated: Mountain

text: Cristina ni eji daa gbɛgbalɔ lɛ kɛɛ akɛ : " Bei pii lɛ , minaa akɛ mihiɛ kɔ ̃ ɔ mɛi krokomɛi anɔ .
ref: Cristina , a regular pioneer , says : " I often find myself looking enviously at others .
translated: Christina is a good girl but she says: "When I grow up, I will go to school and become a great doctor."

text: Côte d 'Ivoire ( ni tsutsu ko lɛ atsɛɔ lɛ Ivory Coast lɛ ) fata maji ni aduɔ kookoo yɛ nɔ waa lɛ ahe .
ref: Côte d 'Ivoire ( formerly Ivory Coast ) is a major producer of cocoa beans , which are used to make chocolate .
translated: Côte d'Ivoire is a country where the sea and the mountains meet.

text: Daa afi lɛ , akalaa woji srɔtoi aaashɛ 2,000 ni kɛ ŋaawoo haa yɛ saji nɛɛ kɛ ekrokomɛi ni he hiaa lɛ ahe .
ref: Each year , some 2,000 different books are published that offer advice on these and other important subjects .
translated: The man has, with his wife, two children and they live in a village and he is a farmer

text: Daa gbi lɛ , adebɔɔ he wolo lɛ baafãi lɛ kɛ mi wieɔ .
ref: Day after day the book of creation spoke to me page by page .
translated: The child is crying, the mother has gone out and left the child alone at home.

text: Dabi kwraa !
ref: On the contrary !
translated: Leave me alone!

text: Dani David aaaye Israel nɔ maŋtsɛ po lɛ , no mli lɛ ewala yaje oshara mli .
ref: Even before becoming a king over Israel , David found himself in the jaws of death .
translated: David came from Israel to our town, and he has been living with us for some time now.

text: Dani tsakemɔ lɛ aaaba , kɛ etsakemɔ lɛ sɛɛ nɔŋŋ hu lɛ , mɛni tee nɔ yɛ Yesu kɛ ekaselɔi lɛ kɛ ' yinɔ nɛɛ ' teŋ ?
ref: Just before and again right after the transfiguration , Jesus and his disciples had what encounter with ' this generation ' ?
translated: And when they had appointed elders for them in every church, with prayer and fasting they committed them to the Lord in whom they believed

text: David Splane , ni lɛ hu eji Nɔyeli Kuu lɛ mlinyo lɛ ji mɔ ni kwɛ lala lɛ nɔ , ni etsɔɔ bɔ ni lala he hiaa ha yɛ jamɔ krɔŋŋ mli lɛ mli kuku .
ref: Conducting the chorus was another Governing Body member , David Splane , who briefly discussed the importance music has in pure worship .
translated: David Splane, if you are not a fool, you would not have said that, and if you are not a fool, you would not have said that, but you have said it, so you are a big fool.

text: David ewieee huhuuhu yɛ hegbɛ ni eshwe waa ákɛ ená ní akɛha mɔ kroko lɛ he .
ref: David did not murmur because someone else was granted the privilege that he himself so earnestly desired .
translated: David is going to the farm to harvest some cassava and bring it home to his mother

text: David le akɛ " heloo lɛ wala yɛ elá lɛ mli . "
ref: David knew that " the soul of the flesh is in the blood . "
translated: David said "hello to the child who is inside the room."

text: David mli fu nuu niiatsɛ ni yɔɔ Natan sane lɛ mli lɛ , ni ekɛɛ akɛ : " Gbii abɔ ni Yehowa hiɛ kã nɛɛ , nuu ni ye nɛkɛ sane nɛɛ , esa gbele ! "
ref: David became angry at the rich man of the story and said to Nathan : " As Jehovah is living , the man doing this deserves to die ! "
translated: And David said to Nathan, "I have sinned against the Lord." And Nathan said to David, "The Lord has taken away your sin, you will not die."

text: Diane kɛɛ : " Mibɔ mɔdɛŋ akɛ maha ena anɔkwale lɛ he miishɛɛ bɔ ni manyɛ .
ref: " I tried to make the truth as attractive as possible , " relates Diane .
translated: They say that when a child is born, it comes with its own destiny and that is why some people are richer than others.

text: Dummelow ŋma lɛ kɛɔ akɛ : " Naagbai ni hiɛdɔɔ yɔɔ mli yɛ nɛkɛ wiemɔi nɛɛ amli lɛ laajeɔ kwraa kɛ ayoo akɛ wɔ - Nuŋtsɔ lɛ ewieee nɔ kome he yɛ mli shi nibii enyɔ , ni akɛ klɛŋklɛŋ nɔ lɛ tamɔ nɔ ni ji enyɔ lɛ . . . .
ref: Dummelow says : " Many of the most serious difficulties of this great discourse disappear when it is realised that our Lord referred in it not to one event but to two , and that the first was typical of the second . . . .
translated: The Dummelow said to them: "You have come to us with a good intention, we thank you very much for that, it is a good thing - We are happy to see you today, it is a great joy, and we are also happy to receive you, that is why we are gathered here today.

text: Dɔlɛ sane ji akɛ , " gbɔmɛi fɔji " yɛ je lɛŋ , ni oti ni ma amɛhiɛ ji ni amɛye gbekɛbii ni bɛ niiashikpamɔ ko lɛ awui .
ref: Sadly , there are " wicked men " in this world who are bent on exploiting innocent children .
translated: The old man said, "the foolish child" is a proverb, which means that if you don't listen to advice and you don't take care of yourself, you will suffer for it.

text: Dɔlɛ sane ji akɛ , apasa tsɔ ̃ ɔlɔi komɛi alilɛi ha mra be mli Kristofoi komɛi tsi amɛhe kɛjɛ Nyɔŋmɔ he .
ref: Regrettably , the tongues of false teachers turned some early Christians away from God .
translated: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing, he makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters, he refreshes my soul, for his name's sake

text: Dɔlɛ sane ji akɛ , yɛ afi 2004 lɛ , ayɔse akɛ John ená kansa .
ref: Sadly , in 2004 , John was diagnosed with cancer .
translated: Since that time, from 2004, the person John has been the one

text: EKOLƐ obaabi akɛ : ' Ani mɔ ko baanyɛ akase bɔ ni Yesu sara eha lɛ ?
ref: YOU might wonder : ' Is it really possible to imitate Jesus ' example of watchfulness ?
translated: What shall we do that we may work the works of God?

text: EKOMEFEEMƆ ni yɔɔ Yehowa kɛ Yesu teŋ lɛ ehi shi kɛjɛ jeŋbɔɔ beebe .
ref: Jehovah created Jesus before all other things .
translated: We give thanks to Jehovah through Jesus that we have eternal life.

text: ENƐ ji yinɔsane mli nifeemɔ kɛha Maŋtsɛyeli shiɛlɔi 82,258 ni yɔɔ jɛmɛ lɛ kɛ mɛi 87,890 ni fata amɛhe kɛye Nuntsɔ lɛ Gbɛkɛnaashi Niyenii lɛ yɛ afi 1998 agbiɛnaa be mli lɛ . [
ref: THIS was a historic event for the 82,258 Kingdom publishers there and the 87,890 who joined them to celebrate the Lord 's Evening Meal in the spring of 1998 .
translated: They have a total of 82,258 households in 87,890 housing units with a population of Nuntsɔ in Gbɛkɛnaashi Niyenii since 1998 census

text: Eba akɛ wɔ fɛɛ wɔbaakase amɛ !
ref: May each of us learn to do the same !
translated: They will come and meet us at the farm tomorrow!

text: Eba akɛ wɔhaŋ hekɛnɔfɔɔ ni bɛ lɛ afite wɔ kɛ Yehowa teŋ wekukpaa ni jara wa lɛ .
ref: May we never allow any lack of trust on our part to damage our precious relationship with Jehovah .
translated: And the people will know that you are my disciples if you love one another

text: Eba akɛ wɔɔbi gbɛtsɔɔmɔ hu kɛjɛ Nyɔŋmɔ mumɔ krɔŋkrɔŋ lɛ ŋɔɔ , ejaakɛ " mɔ ni dũɔ nii yɛ lɛ diɛŋtsɛ eheloo mli lɛ , eheloo lɛ mli ebaakpa fitemɔ kɛjɛ ; shi mɔ ni dũɔ nii yɛ mumɔ mli lɛ , mumɔ lɛ mli nɔŋŋ ebaakpa naanɔ wala kɛjɛ . "
ref: May we also seek the guidance of God 's holy spirit , for " he who is sowing with a view to his flesh will reap corruption from his flesh , but he who is sowing with a view to the spirit will reap everlasting life from the spirit . "
translated: When the elders gather to discuss important matters, they say "a child who does not listen to their mother will be punished by the mother, and the one who does not listen to the mother will be punished by the father; if a child does not listen to their mother, they will be punished by the father and the child will be in trouble."

text: Eba akɛ wɔɔjie nilee kpo ni wɔha wɔfɔlɔi aná miishɛɛ .
ref: May we show wisdom and bring joy to our parents .
translated: They will go to the farm and bring back food for us to eat.

text: Ebaatsu Yehowa yiŋtoo kɛha shikpɔŋ nɛɛ kɛ adesai lɛ he nii kɛmɔ shi , ni akɛ fɛɛ baatse egbɛi ni yɔɔ krɔŋkrɔŋ fe fɛɛ lɛ he .
ref: It will carry out to completion Jehovah 's purpose for the earth and humankind , all to the sanctification of his most holy name .
translated: The Lord will keep your going out and your coming in from this time on and forevermore.

text: Ebaatsɔ gbɛi ni etsɔ nɔ eye ebua Mose lɛ nɔŋŋ nɔ eye ebua bo .
ref: In the same ways that he helped Moses .
translated: The women went to fetch water and they met Moses there and they fetched water

text: Ebaawa !
ref: Not likely .
translated: Let's go!

text: Ebi ehe akɛ , ' Ani nɛkɛ sɔŋŋ matsu nii yɛ biɛ ni miyaaa mihiɛ ?
ref: ' Why am I stuck in this dead - end job ? ' he asks himself .
translated: What is it that you people are doing, is it good that you are beating your child like that?

text: Ebi mi kɛji miheɔ miyeɔ akɛ Nyɔŋmɔ baanyɛ ehã maná miniji enyɔ lɛ ekoŋŋ .
ref: He asked me if I could imagine that God could let me have my two arms back again .
translated: My mother told me that when the Nyɔŋmɔ people were going to farm, they would go very early in the morning.

text: Ebiɔ hemɔkɛyeli dani ayoo akɛ Yehowa ji mɔ ni tsɔɔ eshikpɔŋ nɔ gbɛjianɔtoo lɛ nɔ etsɔɔ wɔ nii .
ref: It takes faith to recognize that Jehovah is the one teaching us through his earthly organization .
translated: We will be like angels and will live forever with Jehovah God in heaven and will see everything clearly

text: Ebɛ naakpɛɛ akɛ no hewɔ ni Yehowa efã akɛ , etsɛŋ ni akɛ Satan gbɛjianɔtoo muu lɛ fɛɛ baaba naagbee lɛ !
ref: No wonder Jehovah has decreed that Satan 's entire organization will soon be brought to an end !
translated: They are now in Jehovah's hands, but Satan is also fighting them, so let us pray for them!
